required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of BMS-908662 in Combination With Ipilimumab in Subjects With Advanced Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study of a RAF Inhibitor (BMS-908662) Administered in Combination With Immunotherapy (Ipilimumab) in Subjects With Unresectable Stage III or Stage IV Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to identify a safe and tolerable dose of BMS-908662 in combination with ipilimumab; and then to evaluate the anti-tumor response to BMS-908662 when administered in combination with ipilimumab.

primary_outcome.measure: Toxicity will be evaluated according to the NCI Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 3
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments approximately every 3 weeks throughout the duration of the trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy as determined by estimates of objective response rates and response duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Efficacy measured every 6 weeks until week 48, then every 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: PK for BMS-908662 as determined by minimum and maximum observed concentrations, time of maximum observed concentration, area under the concentration curve for one dosing interval and the accumulation index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK measured during first 4 weeks on study

secondary_outcome.measure: PD will be assessed by evaluating markers of RAS/RAF pathway activity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PD assessed during the first 4 weeks on study

intervention.description: Capsules, Oral, escalating doses starting at 25 mg, Q 12 h daily, Continuously
Capsules, Oral, escalating doses starting at 25 mg Q 12 h daily for 3 weeks with 3 weeks interval for 4 cycles, then Q12 h daily for 3 weeks every 12 weeks, Continuously
Vial, IV, escalating doses starting at 3 mg/kg, Once every 3 weeks for 6 weeks, then once every 12 weeks, Continuously
Vial, IV, escalating doses starting at 3 mg/kg, Once every 6 weeks for 4 cycles, then once every 12 weeks, Continuously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- Male and female subjects ≥ 18 years of age with a histologic or cytologic diagnosis of Stage III or Stage IV (unresectable) melanoma
- Enrollment to cohort expansion will be limited to only those subjects whose tumors demonstrate the B-Raf V600E mutation
- ECOG ≤ 1
- Adequate organ & marrow function
Exclusion:
- Uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease
- Cohort expansion: Prior therapy with a RAF inhibitor

facility.name: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center & Research Institute

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm
